law.catch_line: Prohibition against refusal of liability insurer to pay on policy for school's posting of Ten Commandments.
law.text: Because the posting of the Ten Commandments in a public school building is a lawful posting of a historical document under KRS 158.195, no liability insurer shall refuse to pay under the terms of the policy an insured who is sued for posting the Ten Commandments in compliance with KRS 158.195 in a public school building on the grounds that this act by the insured constitutes an illegal act for which the insurer is not liable to pay under the terms of the policy.
law.history: Created 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 237, sec. 1, effective July 14, 2000.
